title: Characterization of closure operators. Kuratowski closure axioms

blocks.name: ismrcd1
blocks.content: Any function from the subsets of a set to itself, which is extensive (satisfies ~ mrcssid ), isotone (satisfies ~ mrcss ), and idempotent (satisfies ~ mrcidm ) has a collection of fixed points which is a Moore collection, and itself is the closure operator for that collection. This can be taken as an alternate definition for the closure operators. This is the first half, ~ ismrcd2 is the second. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

thm ismrcd1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → dom((c0 ⋂ =))∈(Moore ` c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : P(c1)→ P(c1)))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ⊆ c1)→ s0 ⊆(c0 ` s0))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ⊆ c1 ∧ s1 ⊆ s0)→(c0 ` s1)⊆(c0 ` s0))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ⊆ c1)→(c0 `(c0 ` s0))=(c0 ` s0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 → dom((c0 ⋂ =))∈(Moore ` c1)), ((w0 ∧ s0 ⊆ c1)→(c0 `(c0 ` s0))=(c0 ` s0)))
  a1ii((w0 → dom((c0 ⋂ =))∈(Moore ` c1)), d(s0, c2))
  a1ii((w0 → dom((c0 ⋂ =))∈(Moore ` c1)), d(s1, c2))

  mpbird((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅), ⋂ hs0 ∈ dom((c0 ⋂ =)), (c0 ` ⋂ hs0)= ⋂ hs0)
  eqssd((c0 ` ⋂ hs0), ⋂ hs0, (w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅))
  sylibr((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅), (c0 ` ⋂ hs0)⊆ ⋂ hs0, ∀(s0 ∈ hs0,(c0 ` ⋂ hs0)⊆ s0))
  ralrimiva(s0, hs0, (w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅), (c0 ` ⋂ hs0)⊆ s0)
  sseqtrd((c0 ` ⋂ hs0), s0, (c0 ` s0), ((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅)∧ s0 ∈ hs0))
  syl3c(((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅)∧ s0 ∈ hs0), (c0 ` ⋂ hs0)⊆(c0 ` s0), ⋂ hs0 ∈ P(c1), ∀(s1,((s0 ⊆ c1 ∧ s1 ⊆ s0)→(c0 ` s1)⊆(c0 ` s0))), (s0 ⊆ c1 ∧ ⋂ hs0 ⊆ s0))
  adantr((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅), s0 ∈ hs0, ⋂ hs0 ∈ P(c1))
  adantr((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅), s0 ∈ hs0, ∀(s1,((s0 ⊆ c1 ∧ s1 ⊆ s0)→(c0 ` s1)⊆(c0 ` s0))))
  3ad2ant1(w0, hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =)), hs0 ≠ ∅, ∀(s1,((s0 ⊆ c1 ∧ s1 ⊆ s0)→(c0 ` s1)⊆(c0 ` s0))))

  anbi2d(s1 = ⋂ hs0, s0 ⊆ c1, s1 ⊆ s0, ⋂ hs0 ⊆ s0)
  sseq1(s1, ⋂ hs0, s0)
  sseq1d((c0 ` s1), (c0 ` s0), (c0 ` ⋂ hs0), s1 = ⋂ hs0)
  fveq2(s1, ⋂ hs0, c0)
  mpbid(((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅)∧ s0 ∈ hs0), (c0 ` s0)= s0, s0 ∈ dom((c0 ⋂ =)))
  sselda(s0, hs0, dom((c0 ⋂ =)), (w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅))
  syl2anc(((w0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ dom((c0 ⋂ =))∧ hs0 ≠ ∅)∧ s0 ∈ hs0), (s0 ∈ dom((c0 ⋂ =))↔(c0 ` s0)= s0), c0[Fn]P(c1), s0 ∈ P(c1))

blocks.name: istopclsd
blocks.content: A closure function which satisfies ~ sscls , ~ clsidm , ~ cls0 , and ~ clsun defines a (unique) topology which it is the closure function on. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

blocks.content: A function is a Moore closure operator iff it satisfies ~ mrcssid , ~ mrcss , and ~ mrcidm . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

thm ismrc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cima(cmrc, cfv(cmre, c1))), w3a(wcel(c1, universe), wf(c0, cpw(c1), cpw(c1)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))), w3a(wss(cv(s0), cfv(c0, cv(s0))), wss(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
